content:
...DOWNTOWN Seattle..., not

...DOWNLOAD Seattle..., unless, of course, it was all virtual.

Seattle and its local filmmakers are really lucky to have a resource like NWFF.  In our area, finding resources and infrastructure for making independant films is like following a breadcrumb trail - sometimes you get lucky and wind up where you want to be; sometimes you just wind up finding someone's dumpster.

Harry - if the producer is interested in running the film at the Melbourne (Florida) Independant Film Festival, I'm sure it would be welcomed - its next September.  Congrats to your mom-in-law!

Chris
Can you tell me the name of the movie that your my mother-in-law joins? I like to see comedy.
Can you tell me the name of the movie that your my mother-in-law joins? I like to see comedy.
Major, major props are due for the Buckaroo comment.  The movie that was promised but was never made.  We need to get this made quick - Peter Weller is getting old.
